news_header: Southern Africa faces a historic drought, leading to national emergencies in several countries and worsening food shortages.
news_text: Countries including Lesotho, Malawi, Zimbabwe, and Namibia have declared a national emergency due to a historic drought affecting southern Africa. Angola and Mozambique are also experiencing drought conditions. Food shortages are expected to worsen until the next crop harvest in March-April next year. The World Food Programme reports that there are 21 million undernourished children in the region and estimates a need for $335 million in aid, of which only 20% has been received.
